It looks awesome in my room and I am very pleased with my decision.  Very little glare with the matte screen and the picture is immaculate.  I had almost waited for the 240hz t.v's to come out since I was nervous about the 120hz, but I haven't noticed any clipping or blurring during action sequences. The truemotion works very well.  I would definitely buy this television again.

Reviews.Title: Terrific TV!!  120hz is a must.
Reviews.Author: W. Leifheit "16by9MovieNut"
Reviews.Content: This is a great LCD TV, the 120hz completely eliminates any motion blur with sports, games or movies.  The matte screen finish also works great in my sunny family room.  I can find easy settings for a great picture in any situation.  The local HD channels available through Comcast look fantastic even via the RF (cable) jack.  My old DVD player (component connection) works great, and looks very good.  I have not yet tested any HDMI connections, as all my old equipment (PS2, Wii, Toshiba DVD player) is working well.  Next up is a Blu-Ray player (PS3??) to see what real 1080p can do.Onboard audio is fine, though I understand the postings by folks who find it a bit thin--if it's your only audio source.  I feed the TV audio output into my surround-sound system most of the time.  The audio-out is always live (my old TV made you choose between internal and external audio) so it's easy to kick up the sound anytime.Shipping via CEVA was not great, their scheduling was confused, but they did allow me to pick up at their distro center.  Their delivery times were very restrictive--and the dispatcher explained the only day available in my area (Wednesdays) and scheduled me for the next available Wednesday.  Monday when I got home from work, there was a notice from CEVA that they had tried to deliver and I needed to reschedule.  I called, and they explained that they only deliver on Mondays in my area.  I told them I had been scheduled for Wednesday--and they asked me to call back on Wed. to reschedule for the next Monday....?  Lousy customer service!  I gave up and went to the distro center to pick it up.  They were helpful and let me open the package to check for damage before I left the site.

Reviews.Title: Smooth purchase of a great TV
Reviews.Author: Woodland
Reviews.Content: We bought a Samsung LN46A630 through Amazon.com last month after researching the options for nearly a year.Amazon.com offered a better price, free shipping, and unpacking and setup at no extra charge. Communication with the shipper was very efficient. The delivery crew had trouble connecting the TV to our satellite system at first, but they figured it out. Overall, everything went very smoothly.The Samsung LN46A650 had been our top choice until we realized how much glare the screen would reflect from our windows. Then we learned about the LN46A630, which has a non-glare (matte) screen. The dynamic contrast is lower with the 630 and there are fewer HDMI inputs. It more than meets our expectations, though.So far, we've connected it to our satellite system, a DVD player, a MacBook Pro, and an iPod. No problem, once you figure out which inputs are which on the back and side of the set. There are some "stealth" features, like the inconspicuous on-off button and other controls on the frame. Referring to the owner's manual does help (!).We are very happy with the Samsung LN46A630, as well as with the purchase process.(Review edited 5/4/09: Our original review complained that the Amazon.com price dropped $500 3 weeks after we bought our TV. Apparently, prices are fluctuating a lot. We discovered that the final price we paid was $300 less than what we thought it would be. That was great news.)

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A630
Reviews.Author: William D. Boehmer
Reviews.Content: The Samsung LN46A630 lives up to its reviews. After much research, I narrowed down my choice to between the LN46A630 & LN46A650. Both are great TVs, but I finalized on the LN46A630 because of its less reflective screen. This was the best choice for my family room environment.I have it mounted on the wall with an articulating mount - a perfect combination! Using the supplied stand or flat or tilt-only wall mounts would be OK, but is less than what this TV deserves.Use with an upconverting DVD player & who needs Blu-ray!I recommend the Samsung/amazon.com HDTV sizing guide - convinced me to go with the 46" class rather than the 42" class.Finally, for anyone concerned about buying a large, fragile item like this online, amazon's delivery worked without a hitch.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: M. Wirtz "311boy"
Reviews.Content: Before I bought this TV, I had done my homework.  I looked at Bestbuy, Circuit City (which was being liquidated), Wal-Mart, Sam's Club, and many websites.  I was not just looking at only Samsungs either.  I could not find a better deal than this LN46A630 on Amazon.  The TV is perfect size, has a quality picture, and the touch of red looks nice too.  I would definitely recommend buying it.

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: MH
Reviews.Content: I have had this thing for a few months now and it's been great.  I love that it has a "Just Scan" option so that with computers I don't have to deal with overscan.  It gives me 1:1 pixel mapping.Watching Band of Brothers BluRay on this thing was just a joy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This TV is fantastic.  Great black levels and picture quality.  The price was great and by purchasing from Amazon I can deny the People's Republic of California the sales tax revenue.  I figure I saved about $700 by buying this way.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Joel
Reviews.Content: I did tons of front end research and have owned TV for a couple of weeks.  Couldn't be more pleased with the decision to buy the 630.  The picture is beautiful and the screen is fantastic at eliminating reflections.  As for the rest... it's a Samsung.  You can't do any better.

Reviews.Title: Happy Customer
Reviews.Author: Tea Cup Lady
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this LCD TV and the white glove delivery service from CEVA was excellent.  This is my second Samsung.  I have a ln40A550 and now the new ln46a630.  Both of these TVs are hooked up to Comcast digital boxes with HD via HDMI.  The picture looks better on the 630 in SD.  Both look great in HD, but I 630 has much fever motion artifacts during fast moving sports scenes.  We use the 550 mainly for gaming and HD content.  The 630 is the main family room TV.  I really light the matte finish.  I'm glad I did not go with the 650.  I love blue-ray on both sets.  The 630 does better with dark scenes but both are very good.  This may sound funny, but the S-Video output from both TV's makes SD look better than HDMI.  The only problem with S-video is that there is only 1 S-video input and it is on the side.  The kids will plug in the Wii to the side inputs, and I will have to constantly unplug it when they are done or just use the HDMI input for SD.  You will be very happy with this TV.  I have not figured out the red border.  I have none.  This may be an option to turn on via the settings, but I'm not interested in turning it on therefore I'll leave it alone.

Reviews.Title: Awsome HDTV
Reviews.Author: S. Erickson "S.Bess"
Reviews.Content: I've had the TV for about a month and have been incredibly impressed with the picture, especially on the 1080i HD channels my cable provider has available. Would I recommend this TV to anyone else, in a word, YES.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV!
Reviews.Author: Matt K
Reviews.Content: I did a ton of research to find the best tv within my price range.  CNET and other various sources pointed towards Sony and Samsung as the clear cut best in field TVs, giving Samsung a slight edge.  CNET gave the 650 version of this TV their Editors' Choice award.  They said that the only thing that was different about the 650 model and this 630 model was that the 650 had too much of a glossy screen and reflected too much ambient light.  Well the 630 solves that problem perfectly.  Sure the 650 has an additional HDMI port but really, who is using a TV of this caliber without some decent HDMI capable receiver anyway?  You should be at least.  Whatever the case may be, the 630 has plenty of inputs for all your needs and even if I didn't have my Onkyo TX-SR606 (which is great in its own) I could still hook up my PS3, HD cable and Blu-Ray player all at the same time without any problems.The 120Hz refresh rate settings are fully adjustable and make a huge difference when watching sports in HD.  The realism is truly incredible.  You probably don't need it though when just watching regular HD TV or movies since the nature of all 120Hz TVs makes the picture look more like video rather than film.  It's hard to explain but even my friends who have absolutely no tech knowledge who came over to watch an episode of House in HD noticed that people walked around a little too realistically.  But the 630 has the option of turning the 120Hz refresh rate down when watching stuff like that.When I bought this I actually went on the Amazon Warehouse Deals section and bought an open box model.  It was listed as open box without any damage and it was almost $200 cheaper than the regular, new, full priced TV.  My TV came in about five days after a woman called to schedule a specific delivery time with a 5 hour window, 12noon - 5pm.  They came at 1pm and brought it up to my 3rd story apartment, unpacked everything and made sure it worked.  I say this because they don't have their "White Glove" option with the Warehouse Deals, but I can't imagine what else they could do with it.  The service was great and the TV turned out to be exactly what they listed it as.  No missing parts, everything worked exactly as it should, not even a single scratch on the TV.  I would definitely recommend going the Warehouse Deals way if you'd rather save a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: Great Set!
Reviews.Author: Bob McCoy
Reviews.Content: I am extremely happy with the choice of the Samsung 630.  The clarity is very good and the sound is excellent.  The low gloss screen is a definite plus with little or no reflection.  The price from Amazon was several hundred less than local stores and there was no sales tax or shipping charges in addition.  The delivery was on time and well done.  I am a little dissapointed in the HD signal over the air, but it may be my antena.  Thanks again for great service.

Reviews.Title: Best place to buy
Reviews.Author: T Daugherty
Reviews.Content: First HD TVChose this modle because of low light reflection. It works great in a very bright front room.Could not ask for a better picture.Easy to set up.USB port is great for Dig. Pics.Experience with Amazon was flawless. Delivery service was the greatest way possible to receive a flat screen HD TV. Set up and tested before they left.Thanks Amazon for this service.Thanks Samsung for this TV

Reviews.Title: Great TV.  Can't beat the price.
Reviews.Author: Kiddydoc
Reviews.Content: I looked for awhile for a good flat screen and I am glad that I waited for this one to come along.  It took awhile to get the screen to be super high resolution like you see in the stores, but with some HDMI cables, a new HD cable box and after finding the HD channels, the picture is quite clear now.  It arrived in perfect condition.  Also got the Samsung Blue-ray which was also a great investment and works well with the TV.  The screen came in handy when my laptop back light went out.  We just used the TV screen as a computer screen for awhile and it worked great.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Mark R.
Reviews.Content: I am extremely happy with the A630.  Most of all, I'm relieved that I went with this model over the glossier screen of the A650.  I didn't realize how much light (direct and reflected) I had in my living room.  A more glossy screen would have been very distracting.If you're buying this TV for the touch of red, don't expect to notice it if it's mounted on the wall.  If you don't have much light behind it, it just looks black, which is fine for me.No regrets about buying this product.  The buying experience was straightforward, the delivery was trouble-free, and a few days earlier than I expected.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46 inch
Reviews.Author: Phyllis Dyche "Phyllis Dyche"
Reviews.Content: We love our new Samsung 46 inch flatscreen.  The hd picture is breathtaking; the sound is good, and I just love recording and waching movies on it. My husband is a golf channel fan, and the hd picture on that is phenomenal. Each blade of grass shows up! It is just what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A630
Reviews.Author: W. Boehmer
Reviews.Content: This TV is as awesome as I expected it to be! I've been watching the Model LN46A650 for almost a year & monitoring the price. As the price dropped, I also started monitoring the Model LN46A630. In the end, the prices on both models were nearly the same & I chose the 630 because of the less reflective screen. This was the right choice for me. The specs on the 650 are slightly better, but I would caution anyone interested in these Samsung units not to underestimate the problem a highly relective screen might cause for them.I have the TV mounted on an articulating wall mount - my preference - the supplied stand would also be adequate.The Amazon "enhanced" delivery worked well with good communication about when, how, etc.Amazon was a great place to purchase this TV!

Reviews.Title: High Quality
Reviews.Author: Benjamin J. Mcclelland
Reviews.Content: The T.V. is a great product. I am happy with the picture and the set up is easy.

Reviews.Title: 46" Flatscreen
Reviews.Author: Sarah Dodds "Sarah-rah"
Reviews.Content: My TV got here ahead of time!  Was in perfect shape except for one minor question I have about the picture quality.  I would definitely do it again!  Saved some good  $$$ purchasing from these guys ;)

Reviews.Title: Great picture, excellent buy
Reviews.Author: A. Michalak
Reviews.Content: Purchased this set for $1350, it arrived 5 days earlier than the shipping estimate. The picture is excellent and the 120 Hz refresh really helps with gaming. Only complaints are the ridiculously large non-universal remote and that there are limited ways of modifying the video settings (not that much fine tuning was needed.)

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!
Reviews.Author: L. Kleinsasser
Reviews.Content: AFTER A LOT OF RESEARCH, I FOUND THAT SAMSUNG WAS SUPPOSED TO HAVE ONE OF THE BEST PICTURES OF THE HDTV'S, AND IT DID NOT DISAPPOINT.  HAS AN AWESOME PICTURE.  LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Excellent LCD
Reviews.Author: Rick in St. Louis
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research on this TV and had it narrowed down between the LN46A650 and this model.  I was really hesitant to go with the touch of color model as I just wanted black, but after having this in my living room and I am very glad I decided to go with it.  The color is barely even noticable.  And the semi-matte screen is excellent.  I was very concerned about getting good black color on the matte versus the glossy, but I would have say that the colors are very vivid on this LCD.I have AT&T; U-Verse HD on this and it looks incredible.  I have also just hooked up a Sony blu-ray player and 1080p is awesome!Excellent job to Samsung for making yet another high quality product.

Reviews.Title: Completely Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Weathergeek
Reviews.Content: First Imprression: Nice looking set, the touch of color (red tinge) that was discussed in some articles as maybe to much is not even noticeable in my family room. In fact it was hard to see at all, its there but just don't worry about it.Now I have not really dug into all the features this tv has but I set up the basics and the picture is great with only some occasional blurring from movement, but that is hardly noticeable. Sound is good, although I did hook up to a surround sound system I already had, which by the way is 12 years old and works with this tv just great.I've only had the set for 2 months but I would certainly recommend it, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Love the Matte Finish & Clear Picture
Reviews.Author: J. Gonzales "Mac1"
Reviews.Content: The clarity of the LN46A630 Samsung LCD HDTV is great.  I am so glad that I chose this model over the high gloss screen of the latest models. Our old set was in a spot where the glare of the sunlight often hit it and made it difficult to watch during the day.  Thankfully we read several reviews about the 630 model's matte finish and decided to go with it.  I'm happy to say watching anything during the middle of the day is no longer a problem.  I do know that by choosing an older model we lost out on some new key features, but from where I'm sitting it was worth the loss.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Equanimous Joe
Reviews.Content: After staring at several LCD TVs at B&M; stores in our city and reading reviews on the web, I decided to purchase the LN46A630 without having the opportunity to view it in any store. I'd viewed in-store the more expensive Samsung model, the LN46A650. I preferred to buy this one since it had almost all of the features of the LN46A650 (was missing one extra HDMI port relative to the LN46A650 and some other minor features) and also had the matte screen, which was a huge plus for me since we had large windows in the room. This model is at a sweet spot for features/price. You get much more than the Samsung 5 Series for a very good price. The picture quality is outstanding and I haven't done any tweaks to any of the settings yet. As far as the matte screen goes, I see no reflections on the screen. This is supposed to have a slightly lower contrast ratio than the glossy screen but I couldn't tell the difference and am far happier with no reflections. The Touch Of Color (TOC) is barely noticeable if this matters to you. On the whole, I'm very happy with the TV so far. Having previously owned two CRT Samsung TVs which worked flawlessly for 8 years, I trust their quality. One thing I will point out is the built-in sound could be better. Menus are easy to figure out - I haven't yet needed to open the manual for anything. Delivery was on time and the TV was set up as promised.

Reviews.Title: HD is GREAT
Reviews.Author: Little DAB
Reviews.Content: THE PICTURE ON HD CHANNELS IS GREAT. THE PICTURE ON THE NON-HD CHANNELS IS OK. NOT AS GOOD AS SONY ON NON-HD, BUT FOR THE PRICE DIFFERENCE, I'LL TAKE THE SAMSUNG.

Reviews.Title: Phyllis goes high def...
Reviews.Author: P. Thomson
Reviews.Content: This HDTV is everything that I'd hoped it would be.  The picture is beautiful and the menu is easy to use. After much research, I'm glad that I chose a set with 1080p and 120 Hz. After trying to adjust the various settings, I decided that "picture reset" gave me the best picture. In other words, Samsung knew what it was doing!

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Jakob D. Pogeman
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a TV for a while.  I first wanted the Samsung 4671 but they discontinued that model.  I wasn't crazy about the new line with the touch of color but thought I would check them out.  I thought the 650 was a good TV but still thought the price was a little too high.  I did not know about the 630 until it was on the Friday sale.  The only differences I saw is it has one less HDMI and a little less contrast.  I can not notice the less contrast though because I have watched many blu-rays and the picure is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV...plain and simple
Reviews.Author: Blake D. Jackson "blackmac82"
Reviews.Content: After about 6 mos of research, my choices for a 46" LCD HDTV came down to this model (LN 46A630) and another Samsung- the LN 46A650. Granted the A650 has a few more perks- 4 HDMI (one more than on the A630), a slightly higher contrast ratio 50,000:1 (instead of 40,000:1 on the A630). But other than that- the A630 is a far superior model in my opinion. Here were the two big issues for me-1.  it has a matte finish and not a super-glare intensive, glossy monstrosity that most people complain about. 2. the Price. Online I got the A630 for about $1300 and the A650 was about $1600 at the time. People say that this TV has some sound issues, but if you are using HDMI cables- you should have no problem. Another thing that bugs me...people...don't buy an HDTV, not get HD cable service/channels and complain that a TV like this one doesn't look good in standard def. Its dumb- don't do it.

Reviews.Title: great tv, great price
Reviews.Author: K. Richardson
Reviews.Content: I originally was looking at the LN46A550, but ultimately went with the A630 model to get the 120HZ feature.  I'm glad I did; the picture is wonderful.  Why not get the 120HZ upgrade when the increased price is so negligible?  I originally hooked up the TV to my theater system receiver using an S video cable (because that is what I already had on the old TV).  I later bought an HDMI cable, and was absolutely amazed how much better the picture is with HDMI--don't even consider hooking up any of your components without HDMI cables--and don't bother to spend $30-$100+ on fancy cables when you can buy HDMI cables for less than $5 that work great.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Sam J
Reviews.Content: So far so good.  The picture is amazing.  The remote is a little hokey.  The delivery service was definitely white-glove.  I'd do it again.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A630
Reviews.Author: F. Guinta
Reviews.Content: Ordered on 1/17/09 and got a good price after researching for a month.  Delivery was a week later and the experience was great.  They arrived within the window of time specified.  They unboxed the TV and put it on my stand.  Also waited till I turned it on and saw a picture.  Hookup was easy, the picture in HD is amazing!  I'm very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: This set rocks!
Reviews.Author: T. Stewart
Reviews.Content: Okay, everything I have read from here to CNET has this t.v. listed as one of the best LCD's of 2008 (actually the 650, but the difference really is the matte screen).  I got this t.v. after I had my LN40A550 stolen from my home.  Thankfully insurance covered the cost, so I shelled out a few hundred more for this set, and I AM SO GLAD I DID!  Being a guy I subscribe to the whole 'size doesn't matter', but the jump from 40" to 46" is amazing.  Just that alone makes the t.v. a plus, but when you add in the 40,000:1 v. 20,000:1, and the AMP feature, this t.v. blows the 550 out of the water!I don't review stuff, I don't recommend stuff, but I've been so blown away with this set I had to at least throw in my 2 cents.  I've never had a problem with Amazon, and their delivery, and once again I wasn't disappointed.  They gave me a 12 day estimate for delivery, but it arrived cross country only 3 days later! The delivery guy brought the set in, set it up, inspected it, and was nothing but professional.  Again, this is why I'm writing this...it's so easy to post a complaint, but far too many people fail to write about the positives.Back to the set...one thing I have no clue about is the 'touch of color' that they are talking about.  My place is full of windows, thus the matte screen, and I can't see any red.  In fact, the only way that I saw any red on the set was when I busted out the flashlight and ran the beam around the edges.  Then I could see it, but if you are expecting anything 'noticeable' then you will be disappointed...If you care less about the 'touch of red', like me, you will be glad to see that it's not even noticeable!All in all, this t.v. is ridiculous!  Watching it right now, and still blown away.  You can wait for the price to drop even further, but I don't know how far it can drop.  The price fluctuates on Amazon through out the day from $1500's to mid-$1400's (from Amazon, not other dealers).  Still $300-$400 less then Best Buy...If you want a great t.v. at a great price...pull the trigger!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46" LCD review
Reviews.Author: R. C. Leonard
Reviews.Content: Product arrived earlier than predicted. Shipper unpacked. We could not immeciately turn on, as unit was cold. After about an hour at room temp turned unit on as per quick setup. Came right up and displayed picture OK. Instructions stepped us thru all setup routines. Easy to follow! Very pleased with matte screen. No reflection problem. Sound is OK, but connected to sound system. Viewing becomes addictive. Very good product.

Reviews.Title: Fully Satisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: SK5555 "SK"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before i got this TV. I think i made a right choice. I am extremely happy with this model. I love the matte finish, perfect for my house since i  have lot of light.

Reviews.Title: Really Nice!
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: Love the TV.  First HD for us, unbelievably clear picture.  Absolutely no glare on screen even though the room has three sides comprised entirely of exterior windows (beach house).  Touch of Color, a potential concern, isn't even noticeable--can't even see it unless the direct sunlight hits it just right, and then it's neat.CEVA delivered it 2 days ahead of schedule (called ahead to determine if that was OK), brought it in the house, unpacked it, placed it on the console, and removed the box.  Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased Viewer
Reviews.Author: L. Rathe
Reviews.Content: We received our 46" Samsung pretty quickly. The delivery people were prompt and friendly. Delivery was quick and picture was good but when we had the satelite company come and connect "wow" what a great picture. So far everything is good but we will buy an extended warranty just to be safe. We were a bit disappointed when Amazon couldn't give us the price that was advertised the next day after we ordered, which of course was lower than we paid.

Reviews.Title: Terrific TV but below average audio.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Man "Aman"
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the picture this set delivers but the sound is very tinny.  Fortunately I use a separate surround sound system when I feel the need.  I can't say enough good things about Amazons service.  I have ordered many items from them over the years, although this was my largest single purchase, and I have always been more than pleased with their service.

Reviews.Title: Samsung HDTV
Reviews.Author: Theodore Wineteer "Professional Engineer"
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best TV in a side by side comparison.  The picture is very good, and the response to movement is better than other TVs.  It was delivered and setup in short order.  Right out of the box it performed very well.

Reviews.Title: great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: sam smith "sam sneeze"
Reviews.Content: I looked into the A750 and this tv for months. The a750 were at times, cheaper then the a650. Did the reveiws and avsforum researches. Finally decided on this tv in my goldbox for $[...] and the $[...] nfl card (where exactly is the upc code on the box, seems to have 4 different bar codes stickers). Well I too have the A panel and last week checked out the S panel version at bestbuy. I did notice the viewing angle is better on the S panel, my screen color washes out slightly viewing at a slight angle. Another annoying thing about this tv is the locations of the inputs in the back. If you are mounting this tv like I am, there's hardly any room between your tv and the wall. I had to mount with a regular wall mount instead of the slim profile type. Monoprice.com is my friend :) got all new hdmi, component cables with mount for less than $[...] shipped overnight in CA. You will not see the touch of red around the bezel on this tv at all. I was a little disappointed, I actually think it looks nice, especially with this slimmer bezel. All in all, this tv is good for rooms with lots of light, I was going to return it for the a750, but the price difference is too much now.

Reviews.Title: IT'S A DREAM TV
Reviews.Author: yoshi "bbb"
Reviews.Content: THis is more than a TV. It's a true media that you've been dreaming about.The quality of picture is amazing.  I understand why everybody say SAMSUNG LCD TV is the best. Almost 1-2 generations seemed upgraded compare to other brands products.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG 46A630
Reviews.Author: John Norris "Desert Bandit"
Reviews.Content: LOVE MY SAMSUNG 46A630, SMOKES THE COMPETIONS SETS. MATTE FINISH SCREEN IS AWSOME, IF YOU HAVE A ROOM THAT HAS ABUNDANT LIGHTING(SUCH AS TO MANY WINDOWS). THIS IS THE SET FOR YOU, EASY SET-UP AND CONTROLS. A WELL THOUGT OUT ROMOTE CONTROL, AWSOME PICTURE WITH BRIGHT COLOR AND THE BLACKEST BLACK. BOUGHT MINE AT AMAZON.COM, BEST PRICE, FREE SHIPPING WITH AWSOME WHITE GLOVE DILEVERY (NO OTHER SELLER  CAN TOUCH THIS, THEY BRING THE SET IN AND SET IT UP FOR FREE)

Reviews.Title: Outstanding picture, excellent value for money, trouble free delivery
Reviews.Author: Ajay
Reviews.Content: Saw the LN46a650 and this model, as well as the Sony XBR and the picture quality was very similar. Having decided on the Samsung, as it was cheaper, I waited till the prices were attractive on Amazon and made my purchase on the 24h of Jan , a week before Superbowl and the expected delivery date was indicated as Feb 3rd. I was surprised when the package tracking provided by Amazon (link to CEVA site) showed an estimated delivery date of 30th Jan, even while the Amazon site continued to show a 3rd Feb delivery date.The logistics company called on the 28th to schedule an appointment. The delivery process was completely flawless and the CEVA staff were very courteous and careful in their handling of the TV. As indicated, it was truly "white glove" delivery as they unpacked the TV and placed it in our family room in the basement.We mistakenly asked for the packaging to be removed and then remembered the UPC required for the $200 NFL store coupon and called CEVA to request for the return of the TV packaging. CEVA was really nice and they called their delivery truck to return the packaging materials.The TV itself is outstanding and all the good reviews were validated. I am really glad I went for the matte screen instead of the LN46a650 as I think it really makes a huge difference even without a direct lighting source behind. As we like to leave the room light on when watching TV, I think the glossy screen would have been distracting.The TV has an amazing array of features and the remote is quite easy to use. The LN650 has a wheel remote that had bad reviews and I am quite happy with the 630 remote that has all conventional buttons. I also found that the the TV automatically switched between the 4:3 and 16:9 aspect ratios when changing between analog and digital channels on the STB. My earlier Toshiba needed a manual change in the this which was quite bothersome.Picture clarity and contrast levels are outstanding and I was blown away by the details visible on a 1080i broadcast with this TV. The poor resolution of SDTV channels are much more apparent now though.Overall the product quality, the Amazon price and delivery made for a really good experience. I think this is without doubt the best TV for its price (and more) in the market and Amazon is really a great place to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV....menus are awkward tho
Reviews.Author: B. Slaughter
Reviews.Content: Watched, waited, looked and looked.  Finally decided on this one and am very happy after about 2 weeks of watching it.No problems, no real complaints.  I, too, have a large window behind my seating area.  The matte finish does a pretty good job of muting the reflections.  the difference is readily apparent when I focus on the glossy frame around the screen and see the reflection that would show up on the 650 model.The only negative so far is to say that the remote menus are a little awkward...like trying to find the 120 hz selection...but you don't do that all the time and it isn't really a big issue.I like that the red light on the front of the TV indicating power goes out when the picture comes on...  There is a goofy melody that plays when you turn it on...like Windows startup...but I found the function to lower the volume or turn it off so even that is all good.CEVA delivery guy was great...I gave him a tip.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and very good delivery service
Reviews.Author: David Clark "flyfisher"
Reviews.Content: I was not well informed about flat screen TVs, but had to come up to speed quickly since I needed to upgrade my old 36" tube TV.  I always extensively research a product and for the Samsung LN46A630, it was no exception.  After about two weeks research, I almost pressed the button to order the LG47LG50, but had a few second thoughts, like should I get 120HZ capability.  I researched more and saw that the Samsung LN46A650 was highly rated by all including the consumer magazine.  A little bit of reading also made me realize I would want the matte screen model of the 650 which is the 630.  We live on a mountain top in Colorado and get abundant sunshine in our many windowed (without shades!) house.  The matte screen is excellent!Great TV, it is all that I expected.  The free shipping by CEVA was prompt, efficient and went without a hitch.  But note that you need to track your shipment on their web site and be in communication with them - they said that had contacted me and had not, apparently.  After I called their local office it went very smoothly.The prospect of doing a major purchase on Amazon and having it shipped was a bit disconcerting, but it went well.  A good ordering and shipping process and a great TV.  Both highly recommendedSamsung LN46A630 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color

Reviews.Title: Great TV as promised
Reviews.Author: R. Moore
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research for the 'right' tv as this is my first LCD - went with Samsung based on reviews and the 630 in particular because of the matte finish best for bright room. I finally pulled the trigger on buying this, ordered it Jan. 16 and got it from Amazon for $1,282 - Great Price!! I got it a week later, delivered by CEVA, no problems with white glove delivery, guys showed up on time, took it out of the box, set it up and tested before they left. I wall mounted this using the Peerless ST650P Tilting Wall Mount for 32" to 50" Flat Panel Displays (Black). Having the tv for a week now, I love it. The picture is great, the sound is sufficient, and I echo all of the other positive reviews on the A630, for the quality and price, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Television
Reviews.Author: C.M. Burns
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN46A630 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of ColorThis is my first LCD TV (my previous television was a 34" Sony CRT HDTV). I've always owned Sony TVs and was sure I was going to purchase a SONY LCD TV when the time came to upgrade. After doing a lot of research (here, at AVS Forums, CNET, etc..) it appeared that Samsung LCDs in the price range I was looking (under $2000) offered the best picture quality. While reading about them on the internet is nice, you really have to go to actually see them before pulling the trigger. Maybe, just maybe I'd like the Sony better after seeing it in person.I went to Sam's first. They actually don't carry (at least not in the store) the LN46A630, but they did have the 650. I noticed how brilliant the picture looked...I liked it better than the Sony next to it (sorry, don't remember which model is was). Once thing I noticed that the screen was very glossy. Our living room has two huge windows and I was concerned about glare (something that we hate about our Sony CRT). After doing a little more research, I read about the 630 and thought it was perfect.BestBuy carries the 630, so I went there to see it in action. I wasn't disappointed. It had a beautiful picture and a nice list of features. This was the one and Amazon offered it for the best price (I checked Circuit City's going out of business sale, but they had the highest price of them all).I currently have it connected via component cable to my HD cable box (my HDMI cables haven't been delivered yet). Picture quality is outstanding on HD channels, though some have a better signal/content than others.  SD channels PQ ranges from excellent to decent, but that's more due to the source and channel. Having such a big screen definitely shows the flaws in some SD channels.I don't have a Blu-ray player yet. That's my next purchase (Samsung BDP-2500), so for now I just have my old progressive scan DVD player. The PQ is good, about what I expected. I'll update this review once I get it.I have it connected to a HT receiver, so I can't comment about the sound.Bottom line is you can't go wrong with this LCD TV. I think you'll be very happy with it, especially considering you can get it for under $1500.UPDATE: I finally got a blu-ray player (BPD-2500) and watched a few movies. The picture quality is incredible! Even standard DVDs look great. I'm really satisfied with this television.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture and I love the Semi-Matte Screen
Reviews.Author: Fahad Alduraibi
Reviews.Content: Before I purchased this LN46A630 TV I was planning to by the [...] because the price difference was not big (sometimes the [...] is cheaper with some rebates and deals) and the [...] has a bit nicer look and some extra features and connections ports. However, some reviewers was taking about how glossy the [...] was, so I went to a near buy circuit city to have a look at both unit and I was shocked to see the 650 screen has a light reflection as bad as the plasma TV's....!!!!Since I hate reflections and they annoy me I switched to the 630 model with the semi-matte screen which looked almost as bright as the [...] (the extra brightness is due to the glossy layer that they have added to the [...]) but without most of the reflection.I don't know about other people, but if I don't mind the reflections or if I am using the TV in a room with no windows or bright light I would go for a plasma TV and save my self some money, and keep in mind that the 120Hz technology is to solve a problem of fast moving objects while Plasma TV's do not have this problem.About the TV itself, it looks awesome however the red touch of color is not as good as the 650 model. the sound is OKThe Picture-in-picture (PIP) is very confusing and I could not get it to work, also there are no buttons on the remote for such feature and you have to go through the menu to access it.Over all this TV is great and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Very nice.
Reviews.Author: W. Reitmeier
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the product.  It has the satin screen that worked well in our great room with no reflection.  Remote is simple and good quality.I've recommended to my friends.

Reviews.Title: LN46A630 - All it was cracked up to be!
Reviews.Author: larivas
Reviews.Content: We purchased this unit after returning a Sony LCD we bought at Sam's and we are extremely pleased.  I have had to do very little in terms of setup to be able to fine tune the picture.  Once we got our HD receiver it was amazing how great of a picture it has.  We definitely feel like we got the top of the line when it comes to LCD TV's.  Outstanding product!

Reviews.Title: WOW! Great deal on a great TV
Reviews.Author: Rance
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW!  I have researched HDTVs for over a month.  I needed something wall mountable for my new home to replace my current Sony Vega rear projection LCD HDTV. I have until now been a proud Sony owner. But in the showroom I was always drawn to the style and picture of the latest Samsung LCDs. I was really leaning toward the latest and greatest, the 950. Thanks to all the excellent product reviews here I checked out the 630 considering the amount of windows in the room.  After going back and forth I elected for the low glare, much lower priced 630.  I ordered this from Amazon for an amazing price of $1299 on Friday morning, Jan 23rd.  The inital estimate for delivery was Feb. 3rd. Based on all the commented issues with CEVA, I was not going to get my hopes up for anything before then.  How surprised was I when I got a call yesterday afternoon wanting to schedule delivery for today between 8 and 12, Jan. 27.  Well, the gentlemen arrived at my home this morning at 9am, way out in the boonies of SC I might add.  They unboxed and setup the TV, even helped me to troubleshoot an HDMI issue with my Dish Network HD receiver.  I am overjoyed with the service and the overall buying experience.  Oh, and the 630 is a great TV.  I will update my comments more about the TV after I have a chance to play with it a bit more.  Thanks to Amazon for such a great price and to CEVA for getting it to me in 4 days.UPDATE:  Well, I've had this awesome TV for a few weeks now.  I have absolutely no complaints.  The picture is just too real to describe.  I see the price has jumped up since I purchased mine.  I'll keep watching for another dip and may get a second one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Picture
Reviews.Author: Digital Rookie
Reviews.Content: Even with a digital signal over an analog cable system this TV's picture is awesome.  With analog signals, it looks a little fuzzy on the edges.  Do not let other reviewers complaints about the "Touch of Red" steer you away from this TV--it is very subtle.  Very easy to set up. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Sawwwwweeeeeeeeeeeet
Reviews.Author: R. House
Reviews.Content: I bought the 46 inch A630 and it's incredible.  This was my first HDTV, and I researched them for weeks, going online, asking experts, and regular people alike.  Eventually, I narrowed it down to between a Sony or Samsung. After talking to the people at Best Buy, I went with the Samsung.  I didn't know that Sonys use Samsung parts.  What's the old saying, "the water is fresher the closer you are to the spring?"  Anyways, this TV is amazing.  The 600 series with the 120 Hz is worth it.  Amazon had it cheaper than anywhere I could find at $1399 plus free shipping.  BUY THIS TV!

Reviews.Title: Most Excellent Product and Value
Reviews.Author: David W. Lott "Dave - Amelia Island FL"
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN46A630 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of ColorDid quite a bit of research on this product from a features and pricing standpoint and have been quite pleased in the 2 weeks since it was delivered.  From a pricing standpoint, the absence of sales tax and delivery charges placed this unit anywhere from $200 - $500+ less than any retailer in the Jacksonville area.After first ordering and being told it would be shipped within 5 days, I later got an e-mail saying it was back ordered and it might be 6-8 weeks before it was available and giving me the option to cancel.  Turned out a week later I got e-mail saying it was available and was being shipped the next day.  Guess the Christmas holidays took its toll on the Amazon inventory system.Delivery was schedule and was completed on-time.  The only disappointment I had was that the delivery person did not really "install" the TV, but only set it on the stand and made sure the power on/off button worked.  Eventhough I had an HDMI cable already plugged in to my cable box to plug in to the back of the set, he would not do that and said that they were not supposed handle connections other than the power cord.Anyway, I was able to set-up without too much difficulty.The only negative I have found is that Samsung customer service told me that the 2008 models do not support universal remote control codes; so I have to use the Samsung remote to turn the TV on/off and change volume and other attributes (picture size) and the cable box remote for changing channels, program guide.  If anyone has any information to the contrary, please post it.All in all, highly pleased with the appearance of the unit and the picture.  Was a little concerned about the red Touch of Color feature, but it is virtually unnoticeable.  Screen glare in minimal and we have it in the family room that has lots of windows on the western side.Would definately recommend this unit.

Reviews.Title: A great LCD TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Mike S.
Reviews.Content: This was recommended to me as a moderately-priced LCD tv with a picture that rivaled much more expensive models.  That proved to be the case, and I would recommend this to a friend in a heartbeat.As others have pointed out, if your tv is going into a bright room the matte finish on the screen is much less reflective than a glossy finish.  The glossy screens look great in the showroom, but if you can't control the light in the room you'll get too much glare off the screen.  Since I knew I couldn't talk my wife into heavy black curtains in her living room, this was an important consideration in this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Best TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jason L. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at end of November and can say I am not dissapointed at all.  I got the TV on sale from Circuit City, (R.I.P.).  The set-up was easy enough with HDMI cables for all of my electronic units.  It took me only a few minutes to actually turn it on and see the picture with a blu ray disc, and it looked amazing with "Black Hawk Down" without any initial picture set-up.I bought an Onkyo receiver and an Onkyo 6.1 speaker set.  I already had a PS3 and XBox360 set-up and had my cable box switched over to a HD box with DVR.  I bought allot of blu ray movies during the big Thanksgiving sale and actually ended up getting a samsung blu ray player for under $100.  I watch my movies on the blu ray player and save my PS3 for gaming.  All these units look amazing on the samsung 630 and they were all an easy hook-up with HDMI cables, (oh, by the way, don't pay more than $5 for HDMI cables as you can find them on Amazon for that price and they work just the same and I havent had any issues.)I did set-up my picture on the tv by going through the AVS forums and taking somme advice from some of the postings on there, and it makes a difference.  I wasnt going to pay $300 for someone to come and set it up for me.  I did it free through the AVS forums as there were plenty of help there and my tv looks amazing now.  This is from a guy who previously had a 27" tv I bought 5 years ago.  I updated my whole entertainment center at once and I can only say I'm in love with it all.As far as the tv goes, it is easy to set-up, there is hardly any glare, and it is the best picture I have seen for the price of under $1500.  You wont be dissapointed.  Take a chance, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: You want low price, you have to dicker!!
Reviews.Author: Jeff B "bassfish62"
Reviews.Content: I love the picture on this TV and agree with the other positive reviews.  I buy a lot from Amazon and almost got this from them because they had the lowest listed price.  I went to HHgregg (their price $1500) just to see the set.  I told them that their price was too high and got them down to $1300, so I took one home.  Most of these places will deal, you just have to ask for a manager and be willing to walk away if they won't give it to you for less.

Reviews.Title: Excellant TV and Super mdelivery
Reviews.Author: N. Epps
Reviews.Content: The is great TV.  Arrived White Glove service faster than I expected. Price was great.

Reviews.Title: Samung TV
Reviews.Author: Kncywells
Reviews.Content: After many weeks of research, I chose Samsung based on user/internet reviews, price-value ratio, and belief they will not go out of business (my plasma broke and the company that made it is no longer in business). I purchased it from Amazon because of the price and free delivery service.I knew I wanted a 42-48" LCD HDTV (had plasma before and didn't want to deal with burn-in issues again). After reading many reviews these were my main concerns with this TV:1. The red Touch of Color design. However, you really cannot notice it unless you get up on the TV and look for it. It is not distracting at all.2. The Auto Motion Plus feature. While this feature truely enhances sporting events, it does make all other programs look weird (like in 3-D). However this is not a problem...just shut it off or set it to low (four settings: low, medium, high, and off) and forget about it (this is what I do).3. The "white glove" delivery service. The delivery man was very nice and timely. No problems at all.I am very satisfied with my purchase and shopping experience with Amazon. I would definitly recommend this product and Amazon without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: Brian Mamahon
Reviews.Content: Received this TV on Christmas eve. Delivery was easy and on time.  They brought it upstairs, unpacked it and removed the trash.  The TV has been great ever since.

Reviews.Title: Love and Adore This Flatscreen... Mostly
Reviews.Author: Charles M. Adams "cinemaguy"
Reviews.Content: Picked this set up as a Christmas present and I do love this set. The picture is stunning when pared with a high quality signal. For those who have yet to take the plunge on HDTV let me share that all channels are not the same with regards to HDTV quality. I know. I was surprised to see that too. But it is not the fault of this set. We selected this model, and not the 650, because of the sunlight in our family room. The matte finish on the screen is perfect. It reduces screen reflection tremendously in a bright room and we do not notice the reduction in contrast ratio compared to the 650.I do have a couple of outstanding issues: the setup menu could be easier to use and could list picture temperature as opposed to only having presets only. It would help in calibrating the set. The other is that I have what seems to be slight uneven brightness that I need to call service about. It is not, from what I read, a weakness of this set or Samsungs in particular. It is a weakness of LCD sets. It is slight and I am the only one who has viewed the set who noticed it. But then I am a perfectionist.You really can't go wrong with this TV. The picture is stunningly, almost distractingly, clear. The black levels are extraordinary. And the sound is very nice. Plus, if it is important to you, the set looks beautiful sitting in our family room. I would buy this set again and again.

Reviews.Title: Great TV so far
Reviews.Author: Jason Owens
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv almost two weeks ago, so this is just an initial review.  Everything I've seen so far has been excellent!  Yes, standard television looks a little grainy, but I expected that, no problem, still looks good to me.  I went out and bought an inexpensive pair of rabbit ears and my local HD channels come in crystal clear.  I'll eventually upgrade my satellite to the HD package and can't wait to see some of my favorite channels on this glorious tv in HD!

Reviews.Title: Simply the BEST
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Ellis "robbiewrites"
Reviews.Content: My first big screen and I could not be happier.  It is much much better than any of my kid's big screens.  Every show looks like the blu-ray demo they do in stores to show off a particular set...but my picture is over the cable to my house (HD channels).

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A630
Reviews.Author: Zona K. Shivers "sunny"
Reviews.Content: Read a lot of reviews before deciding on purchasing this TV.  This was a great purchase for quality/value.  Would recommend to anyone.Samsung LN46A630 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color

Reviews.Title: Best choice for the money.
Reviews.Author: J. Ellis
Reviews.Content: This was our first dive into the HDTV pool.  I researched it to death and my wife in frustration one day said, "just buy the dumb thing".We went with the LN46A630 because our room is full of windows and we didn't want to deal with the reflections.  The matte finish is perfect for well lit rooms.  The picture is incredible.Several reviewers have complained about the sound and I have played with it enough to see how this could be an issue for some.  But the way our room is situated the T.V. is on the short side and not the long side.  We are too close to the T.V. for it to make much of a difference unless we go to surround sound.  And, right now, I'm too old to care that much.Buying an HDTV right now is a lot like buying a computer 10 - 15 years ago.  It comes down to chasing technology and as soon as you buy you're behind the technology curve.  This T.V. is a very good balance between price and technology.As to Amazon's "White Glove Service", they came, they took it out of the box and set it where we asked.  They plugged it in and saw the power light come on and were ready to leave.  I didn't let them leave until I looked it over really well and ran through some channels.  After tracking mud everywhere, they took the box and left.  The service was O.K. but there wasn't anything special.

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Timothy W. Powell "tim"
Reviews.Content: If your thinking about getting this TV, go for it.  At least if your getting a good price.  We paid 1397 + free shipping and white glove delivery (they brought it in, opened it up, setup the TV and made sure it was working before they left)The TV has an incredible picture.  We don't like watching tv now unless it's in HD.  Like most flat screens, the audio isn't the best but don't let that at all stop you from buying this tv.Prices in the store couldn't compare to what Amazon was offering.  Free Shipping, no tax, and a price discounted $200 below Circuit City and $400 below Sears....gotta love Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: My 5 Stars
Reviews.Author: J. Justice
Reviews.Content: I give 5 stars. Read the product description.  That's what I expected and that's what I got.  However the Auto Motion Plus 120Hz took a little to get used to but you can always turn that off.  Overall very pleased.

Reviews.Title: High quality LCD TV
Reviews.Author: slategrey
Reviews.Content: The 46" Samsung LN46A630 meets all of our expectations with a clear picture, plenty of input options, and a stylish design.  It has 3 modes to adjust brightness based on room lighting, fast 4ms response time, and little glare on the matte screen. It is also Energy Star compliant.  We did a lot of research, but chose this model over similar Sony and Toshiba TVs because of the higher contrast ratio and the ability to update its firmware using USB.  Compared to the other brands, we found it was an excellent value for the price ($1299).

Reviews.Title: best LCD TV I've seen
Reviews.Author: T. Dixon
Reviews.Content: The Samsung LN46A630 46" LCD TV is absolutely phenomenol.  We did a lot of research before making this purchase direct from Amazon.com and couldn't be more pleased.  In the end we relied on Consumer Report which had Samsung rated the highest in all screen sizes over 32".  We had to decide between this model and the LN46A650 and decided on this one because of the anti-glare screen.The color quality is the best I've seen and the audio is very good, as well, especially at mid-range.  We do plan to add a home theater speaker system but only to create more of a theater atmosphere.  This TV is very easy to install and the manual is very easy to follow.  Using HDMI cables makes the installation a piece of cake and the remote is user friendly.  Once you start using this TV you truly won't want to turn it off.  It's that good.  We are using this TV in a downstairs area with some windows and interior lighting so we were concerned about glare and reflections.  On the other hand, we also didn't want to sacrifice picture quality.  After watching movies, sports events and regular programming on this TV we can confidently report there is no sacrifice of picture quality with this model.  In addition, we have purposely used it during the day with all inside lighting turned on and have not seen any glaring or reflections, which is amazing.Amazon.com was wonderful to work with.  Not only did they have the best price but the free delivery was completed within one week of our online purchase.  We are completely satisfied with this product and with the seller and would highly recommend both.

Reviews.Title: Matte screen makes all the difference
Reviews.Author: L. Williams
Reviews.Content: After much research I chose the LN46A630, which has the same specs as the 650 but has a matte screen instead of a glossy glass screen. It was supposed to be delivered by Dec 23rd but arrived on Dec 17th!! The delivery guy brought it into our home, unpacked it and placed it on our TV stand, then stood by as I plugged it in and turned it on. He didn't provide me with a checklist as the White Glove Service said he was supposed to (I realized this later) but everything is working fine and the picture is wonderful. I was uncertain about the sound capabilities, but was extremely pleased with the quality of the 630's downward firing speakers. They are quite acceptable for in-TV speakers and have a good spectrum of bass, midrange and treble. We'll be hooking up some external speakers in a few weeks to get even better sound, but I can easily live with the internals with no problems. They're not tinny-sounding whatsoever.Note: Make sure your TV is hooked directly to your incoming cable (if you use cable). I initially had the cable going through an old Samsung VHS recorder, and its internal tuner produced substandard quality video on the new TV. Once I realized I should plug the cable directly into the TV, the images onscreen improved dramatically, and that was even with standard definition channels.Our local Brighthouse cable provider will be hooking us up with high-def reception in the coming week, so I'm jazzed about what we'll be seeing in the near future. Add to that the switchover from analog to digital broadcasting on February 17, 2009 and the results should be astounding on both high-def and standard images. I'm hoping that the new digital broadcasts will take advantage of the entire screen. Current standard def has black bars at the left and right sides of the screen when set to 4x3 size (to get the whole image). I keep it at 4x3 for most channels, and detest the stretched look of 16x9.Our new 46" Samsung 630 replaces an ancient 27" Samsung tube TV that we've had for over 10 years. The 630 gives you the high-quality picture and sound you're looking for, but without the awful glare of the 650. I highly recommend this product.UPDATE 23 MAY 2009: We've been living with the 630 for 6 months now, and it continues to be a terrific purchase. It's been trouble-free and the picture and sound continue to astound. I continue to highly recommend the 630 over the 650. You will be impressed with its color and have none of the reflections of the 650's glossy screen. Superb product from Samsung.UPDATE 4 JANUARY, 2010: The 630 continues to be a wonderful and trouble-free LCD TV. We haven't had any trouble with it for over a year, and the image quality and sound are terrific. The High Definition channels we watch are absolutely stunning. I'm very pleased with Samsung's quality.UPDATE 30 APRIL, 2011: The 630 just doesn't quit! We've had nearly 3 years of completely trouble-free viewing, and I'm blown away with the quality and longevity of this product. Hey Samsung: Need another spokesperson? I love this TV!!!

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: T. McKinney "TJM1976"
Reviews.Content: Great TV, great price compared to the big box stores. Like the others have mentioned, the TV speakers arent the greatest.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jayme T. Little
Reviews.Content: Great TV, great picture.  Electronics Expo shipped the product as they said they would, and it arrived earlier than the expected date in excellent condition.  I thought it would have come by special carrier, but UPS delivered.  Great TV, and the 46" is perfect for a medium living room.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A630
Reviews.Author: Brian E. Backensto
Reviews.Content: Great Picture and exceptional value.  Did a lot of research and cheapest we could find this product antwhere was $1,700.  Can't find a better TV anywhere for under $1,500 with all the features of the A630.  Only downside is that it did not have the Red Touch of Color as advertised.  I complained to Samsung and they admitted that some units were shipped without it in error and agreed to send someone to the hose to fix it, but we decided to keep it as is.  Didn't want anyone taking apart our perfectly good set.  Everyone who watches it is amazed by the picture, especially sports!

Reviews.Title: Just Buy IT!
Reviews.Author: Sunday couch Potato
Reviews.Content: I know do you really want to make a purchase this size over the internet.I did the same thing ,but just do it.You can't beat the price,no tax and no shipping its a no brainer. When my tv arrived there wasn't the smallest mark on the box. The picture is great the matte screen does not reflect I am very impressed,and I figured I saved about $600 can't go wrong with this tv. The red toc is almost non-existant on this model so there is no distraction from the color I have windows on one side as well as opposite the tv and only in certain light is it a problem but it is way better than my tube tv.All in all no complaints and don't worry amazon is great to deal with and the shipping was painless.

Reviews.Title: Samsung ln46a630  but beware
Reviews.Author: Joseph W. A. "ja"
Reviews.Content: Okay i'm gonna keep it short.tv is awesome at a straight on angle  if you move left or right  about 8 ft off center,the tv looks pastel.this is part i am not happy about.I kept the tv anyway because i will notrun into this problem because,the place or place i will be using this tv is not that wide.I have An "A" model screen of the  big on going bait and switch thing that samsungis doing .If you dont know about it there are 3 types of screens  A,C or S S being the best.Start doing your research online maybe avs forum. There was a big thread on amazon about this but has since been removed.It's very obvious that This is a Real issue.Once again i love the tv  very low glare from matted screen  but as for the viewing angle and the bait and switch samsung screens .....I feel duped by samsung and possibly amazon for not Addressing the issue.Maybe that's why i got it at the time for $1299 free shipping w/ a $200 gift card from NFL shops. I am a big Amazon user and love them but, This issue is real and must be addressed  I feel class action law suit coming for Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Review of 46' Samsung HD TV
Reviews.Author: Ed W. Shallenberger
Reviews.Content: We have put off buying an HDTV for several years.  Amazon offered this TV at a deal we couldn't refuse.  We are very pleased with the purchase.  The picture is truly spectacular and we aren't even watching in HD yet.  We are very pleased with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Closed Captions not available via HDMI
Reviews.Author: Stephen Woolpert "Steve w."
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed to discover that this TV's closed caption feature will not work in HDMI, component, or PC modes. My wife is hard of hearing so this is an important feature. I don't understand why Samsung would offer a feature that doesn't work with the hookups that provide the best HD picture. I can enable closed captions from the menu on my cable box, but it takes several steps to do it, and then it's on for everything. It would be much more convenient to be able to use the button on the TV's remote to turn them on and off as needed.

Reviews.Title: decent TV, but not exceptional
Reviews.Author: John Miller
Reviews.Content: Update - I got a LCD screen model "A", which is the lousiest of the three screens put in Sansung TVs. Some reviews are written by folks, who have moved from analog TV to digital TV. Any digital TV will look amazing by comparison. Short of opening the box and looking on the back of the TV to the right of the model number there is no way to tell if you are getting a godd LCD made by Samsung or C or A screens. Channel displays vary from excellent to impossibgle to watch. DVDs are washed out and fuzzy. That is fuzzy in comparison to Netflix internet streamed movies, if you need a comparison. The old Magnavox played the same movies with perfect color and crisp sharpness, by comparison. THE set is going back. I'll try a SHarp and see if I have any better luck. I revise my rating to one star for the excellent remote, tuner and on screen displays. None of those matter when the picture is so bad that it is unwathcable.**********************This is a review based on a couple of hours of experience after delivery. This unit replaces my Magnavox (Philips) digital LCD model 37MF321D. It worked perfectly, if you could get it to go on. The latter is the reason that I replaced the unit. I recycled the Magnavox, giving it to a neighbor, who had no TV. If you leave it on all the time, it works perfectly. I would have gotten a Philips TV (best rated picture display in Europe) except that I was put off with many complaints about sound problems.Basics: I live in Houston, Texas. I use $10 Radio Shack rabbit ears. My viewing habits are primarily movies from Redbox and Netflix. My DVD player is a basic Sony, model DVP-NS57P. I don't believe it upscales to 1080P or 1080i. I sit about ten feet from the screen.After tuning via auto, I removed religious, Hispanic, and duplicate channels. What remains are channels 2.1, 2.2, 8 (8.1 is out of range), 11.1, 11.3, 13.1, 13.2, 13.3, 20.1, 26.1, 39.1, 51.1, and 55.1. I can afford either Cable or Uverse, but chose not to spend $600 minimum to watch the couple of channels that interest me, like the SCI-FI channel and the History channel. Direct broadcast channels received on cheap rabbit ears are much sharper than either Uverse or Cable feeds.The picture on the 1080i Magnavox was significantly superior (clarity and color stability) on average, particularly on weaker channels like 2.2. That is probably not an issue with commercially provided cable or Uverse, because the picture quality is not as good to start with. The Samsung tuner is much more sensitive than that on the Magnavox. With the Magnavox I had to reposition the rabbit ears to receive some channels. Samsung's tuner receives all digital channels without having to move the rabbit ears.So far I have noticed no improvement in quality because of the 120HZ  refresh rate versus the 60HZ that I had. Paying significantly more for 120 HZ is not worth it for the average viewer. The reason that I went with the 120HZ 630 versus the 60HZ 530 was two fold. One: the higher refresh rate unit was only $50 more - 1350 versus 1300. Two: there were negative comments about 530 and 550 model screens made in nonSamsung plants on the. Although the situation may be the same with the 650 and 630 TVs, I did not see any reviews bringing up that issue.The ten-inch long remote has button lighting, which is a great feature. The TV comes with the swivel stand attached. The sound quality and volume are both better than I expected. As is the case with most of these devices the sound volume varies, depending on the input source, channel, and TV mode (analog/digital.) I am not a fan of the high gloss framing around the screen. I would have hated a high gloss screen surface of the LN46A650. I have not read the instruction book, so I can't comment on features that I probably will never use.The display options are vastly superior to those offered on the Magnavox. When you push the CHLIST button all saved channels pop up as an overlay to the currently watched channel. The channel list includes the station name and title of the active show. Deleting channels is easy. Push CHLIST, scroll to the channel that you want to remove, push Tools, and select delete.DVDs are displayed well with colors comparable to the Magnavox. Due to the larger screen size (46 Inch versus 37 inch) detail is compromised somewhat.Delivery: The set sat in Dallas four days and in Houston one day. It was delivered on time, notwithstanding my feeling that it could have been delivered five days earlier. The crew unboxed and made sure the TV worked properly before leaving. I retained the box incaser the TV dies within a week. After that I'll throw it out or turn it into a spare bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A630
Reviews.Author: Turd Ferguson "Always wait for the deal"
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the tv. Did a lot of research so I knew what I was getting. 1 problem, if the power saver on the tv is on, whatever emission or signal is being put out by the tv gets in the way of the signal between my U-verse remote and box. Turn off the power saver, works fine. Samsung says other similar models have a firmware update that cures this problem and this model will soon have it. That's it, everything else is great!!!!

Reviews.Title: Can't review what doesn't power up
Reviews.Author: Marylin A. Isabella "World Traveler"
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research before purchasing this TV.  Problem is - the TV does not power up, so I am unable to write a review!  Never having purchased a Samsung (always purchased Sony), I am reluctant to purchase another one.That said, so far Amazon has been great about the return.

Reviews.Title: I got a LEMON!
Reviews.Author: M.Nguyen
Reviews.Content: ARG. So fustrating!!!I finally got my new 46" Samsung (LN46A630) delivered by Amazon last Wednesday... and it was already defective! I'm so mad that I actually reviewed the good and few bad reviews on here and took my chances on buying this TV.I had the same problem that most other negative reviewers did. As I would watch tv or DVD, the screen would snow-out (red and green lines) and emit an incredibly startling high-pitched screech for 30-45 seconds before shutting itself off. It would take about 60-120 seconds to re-power itself. It continues to do this every 10 mintues or so and makes it impossible to watch anything!I've called Samsung service and they put a work order to a local repair shop to get it fixed. The guy at the shop didn't even talk to me to clarify the problem, but left a message indicating he knows whats going on and already has some parts on order (power board). I am still waiting for parts to come before scheduling the repair appointment. And still at home without a working TV!What a shame this must obviously be a defect in the manufacturing of this model - and yet Samsung continues to sell it?!? Unbelieveable. I should've gotten the Sony Bravia my friend tried to convince me to get!

Reviews.Title: Greg T
Reviews.Author: Greg C. Tippett
Reviews.Content: Recently my daughter bought a new samsung 46a550 and told me if I was going to buy one, this would be the way to go.  After reading all I could, shopping around, and comparing specs and prices I decided to do the same.  But I also liked the 630, for all the reasons stated on this site.I was patient, and finally visited a local dealer in the Portland area and found that the price I could get on the 630 was about the same as the 550.  So I pulled the trigger quickly and will receive the set in about a week.I'm going to come back here and update this posting, to see if I would continue to support this product, or not.  But frankly, I believe I got the best set (630) for the best price I could find.  And, that make me very happy.

Reviews.Title: I strongly DO NOT recommend this product.
Reviews.Author: Pamela Chaney
Reviews.Content: Sorry to say the delivery man just came back today to take it back to Amazon Warehouse.  VERY bad picture, blurry, ghosting, all around it has a bad choice.  It's a lower end model and it showed.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: pogo
Reviews.Content: We feel spoiled with this television.  We used to think that DVDs were the clearest picture we'd ever see on a television, but now the comparison with the HDTV broadcast picture makes DVDs look like the last decade's VHS.  The controls are nice and intuitiveThe only complaint I have about the television is that it wasn't clear that the "picture-in-picture" feature can only be used when viewing two analog stations.  This means the feature will for all intents and purposes not exist come February, 2009.

Reviews.Title: broke after 5 minutes
Reviews.Author: sat
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in other reviews, this TV broke after 5 minutes of viewing.It started turning itself ON and OFF in an infinite loop.

Reviews.Title: wish it worked
Reviews.Author: Eva M. Kanto "calskier"
Reviews.Content: have 52 inch tv well within limits, it cannot support the weight, so the TV is angled towards the ground, almost unwatchable. Contacted  supplier for assistance, they were of little help. Spend the extra money  on a better one or have a large whole in your wall to show for it
